body_html:
The protobuf installation is unpacked from a zip file here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/install/install_proto3.sh#L29
Maybe the executable permissions aren't preserved when unpacking. (Although it seems to have the right permissions when I unzip that file on my laptop)

Edit: It might be the fact that the file has 550 permissions once unzipped, and is owned by root, while we're trying to execute it as the user that we mapped into the container.

body:
The protobuf installation is unpacked from a zip file here: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/install/install_proto3.sh#L29
Maybe the executable permissions aren't preserved when unpacking. (Although it seems to have the right permissions when I unzip that file on my laptop)

**Edit:** It might be the fact that the file has `550` permissions once unzipped, and is owned by root, while we're trying to execute it as the user that we mapped into the container.
